pr_title: Instead of ServiceClient, taking ServiceClient.Builder from Client builder, expose CredentailInterceptor in Client builder

timeline.message: Instead of ServiceClient, taking ServiceClient.Builder from Client builder, expose CredentailInterceptor in Client builder

timeline.bodyText: Honestly, I don't like this. Can we do it right first time rather than "fix" it later?
timeline.author: JianpingChen

replies.bodyText: I agree, unfortunately, the core gen doesn't have support to indicate that an IType is child type, so this import fixing. Didn't spend much time designing that in the core since there is only one child type scenario today, lets circle back once the high priority items to unblock chat is done.
replies.author: anuchandy

timeline.bodyText: Ideally, all properties should be handled the same way.
timeline.author: JianpingChen

replies.bodyText: yep, the reason for this filter is - here we are deriving the service ctr args, so we filter items that are not ctr args. I could avoid filter by defining one additional stream.
replies.author: anuchandy

timeline.bodyText: Could have done this when the constructor is defined
timeline.author: JianpingChen

replies.bodyText: this is a mapping from builder param to client ctr param, so ctr definition has the type that the builder produces not the builder.
replies.author: anuchandy
